member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.Print(System.String,C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.ScaleMode,System.Windows.Thickness,System.Int32)
member.summary: Prints the grid using a specified scale mode.
member.param: Name of the document to print.
How to scale the document to fit the pages.
Margin around the page in pixels.
The maximum number of pages to print.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.GetPageImages(C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.ScaleMode,System.Windows.Size,System.Windows.Thickness,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets a list of elements that represent parts of the grid fit for rendering into pages of a document.
member.param: How to scale the document to fit the pages.
Size of the pages in pixels.
Margin around the page in pixels.
The maximum number of pages to print.

Returns the number of vertical pages. Note that if C1DataGrid width doesn't fit to the specified page width, each vertical page is additionally split horizontally to subpages that fit to the specified width, so one vertical page is represented by multiple items in the collection returned by this method. This out parameter returns the number of vertical pages, that doesn't take into account horizontal splits. The number of horizontal subpages for each vertical page can be calculated by dividing the number of items returned by this method by the value returned in the parameter.
member.returns: A list with elements that correspond to the pages.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.GetPageImages(C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.ScaleMode,System.Windows.Size,System.Windows.Thickness,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets a list of elements that represent parts of the grid fit for rendering into pages of a document.
member.param: How to scale the document to fit the pages.
Size of the pages in pixels.
Margin around the page in pixels.
The maximum number of pages to print.
Indicates whether page info like a page number/count should be added to the generated images.

Returns the number of vertical pages. Note that if C1DataGrid width doesn't fit to the specified page width, each vertical page is additionally split horizontally to subpages that fit to the specified width, so one vertical page is represented by multiple items in the collection returned by this method. This out parameter returns the number of vertical pages, that doesn't take into account horizontal splits. The number of horizontal subpages for each vertical page can be calculated by dividing the number of items returned by this method by the value returned in the parameter.
member.returns: A list with elements that correspond to the pages.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of a .

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.OnApplyTemplate
member.summary: Builds the visual tree for the control when a new template is applied.
member.remarks: This method is invoked whenever application code or an internal process, such as a rebuilding layout pass, calls the method.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.AutoGeneratingColumn
member.summary: Occurs when the auto-generated columns are being created.
member.remarks: You can change the auto-generated column by setting the property . You can cancel an auto-generated column by setting the property to true, in this case there will not be column for this property.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.AutoGeneratedColumns
member.summary: Occurs after all the auto-generated columns are created.
member.remarks: You can use this event to reorder the auto-generated columns by setting the of the columns.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.MergingCells
member.summary: Occurs after the measuring the cells, so that the user can combine adjacent cells. In order to merge the cells you should call the method Merge of the passed in.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.KeyDown
member.summary: Occurs when a keyboard key is pressed while the has focus.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.CreatingRow
member.summary: Occurs when a row is being created in the model, so you can override the creation returning a different row type.
member.remarks: Typically used to inject custom rows like SummaryRow, TemplateRow, etc

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.LoadingRow
member.summary: Occurs when a data item is being loaded in the model This might happen both by bringing the row into view or requesting the row programmatically.
member.remarks: Typically used to initialize properties for a particular row.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.LoadedRowPresenter
member.summary: Occurs after the visual element of the row is added in the visual tree and is ready for interaction.
member.remarks: Typically used to set visual properties to the row visual element. Please note you might need to unset the visual properties in the event.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.LoadedCellPresenter
member.summary: Occurs after the visual element of the cell is added to the visual tree and is ready for interaction.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.LoadedRowHeaderPresenter
member.summary: Occurs after the visual element of the row header is added to the visual tree and is ready for interaction.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.LoadedColumnHeaderPresenter
member.summary: Occurs after the column header presenter is added in the visual tree and is ready for interaction.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.LoadedRowDetailsPresenter
member.summary: Occurs after the visual element of the row details is added in the visual tree and is ready for interaction.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.UnloadingRow
member.summary: Occurs after a row is unloaded from the model.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.UnloadedRowPresenter
member.summary: Occurs before the visual element of a row is removed from the visual tree.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.UnloadedCellPresenter
member.summary: Occurs before the visual element of a cell is removed from the visual tree.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.UnloadedRowHeaderPresenter
member.summary: Occurs before the visual element of a row header is removed from the visual tree.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.UnloadedColumnHeaderPresenter
member.summary: Occurs before the visual element of a column header is removed from the visual tree.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.UnloadedRowDetailsPresenter
member.summary: Occurs before the visual element of a row details is removed from the visual tree.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.BeginningEdit
member.summary: Occurs before a cell begins to be edited.
member.remarks: This event typically occurs when the user press F2 over a cell or click a cell or a row that already contains the current cell. You can cancel the event setting to true.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.BeganEdit
member.summary: Occurs after a cell began to be edited.
member.remarks: This event typically occurs when the user press F2 over a cell or click a cell or a row that already contains the current cell. This event can be used to modify the editing control.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.CommittingEdit
member.summary: Occurs before a cell change is committed.
member.remarks: This event typically occurs when the user press enter or tab in an editing cell. You can cancel the event setting to true.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.CommittedEdit
member.summary: Occurs after a cell editing has been committed.
member.remarks: This event typically occurs when the user press enter or tab in an editing cell.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.CancelingEdit
member.summary: Occurs before a cell change is canceled.
member.remarks: This event typically occurs when the user press escape in an editing cell. You can cancel the event setting to true.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.BeginningRowEdit
member.summary: Occurs before a row begins to be edited. A row begins to be edited when one cell of the row begins editing and there was not previously editing cells in the row.
member.remarks: You can cancel the event setting to true.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.CommittingRowEdit
member.summary: Occurs before a row editing is committed. A row editing is committed when a cell of the row has been previously edited and the current cell is changed to a cell which does not belong to the edited row.
member.remarks: You can cancel the event setting to true.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.CommittedRowEdit
member.summary: Occurs after a row editing has been committed. A row editing is committed when a cell of the row has been previously edited and the current cell is changed to a cell which does not belong to the edited row.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.CancelingRowEdit
member.summary: Occurs before a row editing is canceled. A row editing is cancelled when the user press escape. Notice that whether escape is pressed on an editing cell the action will cancel the editing of the cell, if escape is pressed again the changes in the whole row will be reverted.
member.remarks: You can cancel the event setting to true.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.SelectionChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the SelectedItem or SelectedItems property value changes.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.SelectionChanging
member.summary: Occurs before the selection changes.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.CurrentCellChanged
member.summary: Occurs when a different cell becomes the current cell. Typically this occurs when a user clicks a cell, but it can be set programmatically too by setting and .

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.SortChanging
member.summary: Occurs before the sorting state of is changed.
member.remarks: Sorting state changes when user click in a column header or when the SortBy method is called.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.SortChanged
member.summary: Occurs after the sorting state changed.
member.remarks: Sorting state changes when user click in a column header or when the SortBy method is called.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.FilterChanging
member.summary: Occurs before the filter state of is changed.
member.remarks: Filtering state changes when user manipulates the filter included in the column header or when the FilterBy method is called.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.FilterChanged
member.summary: Occurs after the filtering state changed.
member.remarks: Filtering state changes when user manipulates the filter included in the column header or when the FilterBy method is called.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.GroupChanging
member.summary: Occurs before the grouping state of the is changed.
member.remarks: Grouping state changes when user drag a column on the grouping panel or when the GroupBy method is called.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.GroupChanged
member.summary: Occurs after the grouping state changed.
member.remarks: Grouping state changes when user drag a column on the grouping panel or when the GroupBy method is called.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.BeginningNewRow
member.summary: Occurs when a new row begins to be edited.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.CommittingNewRow
member.summary: Occurs before a new row is committed, allowing to cancel the action.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.CommittedNewRow
member.summary: Occurs after a new row is committed.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.CancelingNewRow
member.summary: Occurs when a new row is canceled.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.DeletingRows
member.summary: Occurs before a deletion of rows happens.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.RowsAdded
member.summary: Occurs after new rows have been added to the .

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.RowsDeleted
member.summary: Occurs after rows have been deleted from the .

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.ColumnHeaderDragStarted
member.summary: Occurs when a column header drag operation started.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.ColumnHeaderDragDelta
member.summary: Occurs when a column header is being dragged.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.ColumnHeaderDragCompleted
member.summary: Occurs when a column header drag operation finish.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.ColumnReordering
member.summary: Occurs before a move column operation is committed. The move operation can be started by the user when it drops a column header in a new position or when method is called.
member.remarks: The move operation can be cancelled by setting property of the event arguments to true;

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.ColumnReordered
member.summary: Occurs after a move column operation is committed. The move operation can be started by the user when it drops a column header in a new position or when method is called.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.ColumnResizing
member.summary: Occurs while the user is resizing a column by dragging the border on the right of the column header.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.ColumnResized
member.summary: Occurs when the user release the mouse after dragging the border on the right of the column header.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.RowDetailsVisibilityChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the visibility of a row details changed.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.RowResizing
member.summary: Occurs while the user is resizing a row by dragging the border at the bottom of the row header.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.RowResized
member.summary: Occurs when the user release the mouse after dragging the border at the bottom of the column header.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.FilterLoading
member.summary: Occurs before the filter of a column is loaded allowing to change the filter that will be displayed to the user.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.FilterOpened
member.summary: Occurs when the filter of a column is opened by clicking the button on the right side of the column header.

member.summary: Gets the collection of rows that are placed on top of the item rows.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.BottomRows

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.CurrentCell
member.summary: Gets or sets the cell that contains the focus inside the . This cell can be changed by the user when navigating with the keyboard or mouse interaction.

member.summary: Gets the collection of selected items.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.Selection
member.summary: Gets the selection object which allows to query the current selection as well as modifying it.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.GroupedColumns
member.summary: Gets the collection of columns whose is different from null. This group of columns determine the grouping state of the .
member.remarks: The order of the columns in the array is the order the groups are created.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.FilteredColumns
member.summary: Gets the collection of columns whose is different from null. This group of columns determine the filtering state of the .
member.remarks: Use property in order to change the logical way the filter predicates are joined.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.SortedColumns
member.summary: Gets the collection of columns whose is different from null. This group of columns determine the sorting state of the .
member.remarks: The order of the columns in the array is the order the data is sorted.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.Viewport
member.summary: Gets useful information about the scrolling state as well as current top/left or bottom/right shown cells.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.IsFilteringRowsAllowed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether it is possible to filter rows according to the inner and configuration.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.IsSortingRowsAllowed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether it is possible to sort rows according to the inner and configuration.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.IsGroupingRowsAllowed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether it is possible to group rows according to the inner and configuration.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.IsDetailsTogglingAllowed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether it is possible to toggle row details according to the configuration.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.IsAddingNewRowsAllowed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether it is possible to add new rows according to the inner and configuration.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.IsRemovingRowsAllowed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether it is possible to remove rows according to the inner and configuration.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.IsEditingRowsAllowed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether it is possible to edit rows according to the inner and configuration.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.SelectionDragStarted
member.summary: Occurs the first time the mouse is dragged in the area containing the rows.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.SelectionDragDelta
member.summary: Occurs when the mouse is being dragged in the area containing the rows.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.SelectionDragCompleted
member.summary: Occurs when the mouse drag operation in the area containing the rows is completed.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.AutoGenerateColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether columns are created automatically when the property is set.
member.remarks: The event will be raised for each column allowing to change or replace the generated column. After all columns are created the event will be raised.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.ItemsSource
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection that is used to generate the content of the control.
member.remarks: If the collection passed in is a , the group, filter, and sort operations will be delegated to it.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.CanUserReorderColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user is able to reorder columns by dragging the corresponding column header.
member.remarks: When the column header is being dragged an indicator will appear to determine the position where the column will be moved to. Dragging a column close to the viewport border will cause the data grid to auto-scroll.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.CanUserResizeColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user is able to resize a column by dragging the right border of the column header.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.CanUserResizeRows
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user is able to resize a row by dragging the bottom border of the row header.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.CanUserFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user is able to filter a column by opening the corresponding filter popup in the column header.
member.remarks: If set to false, no filter will be shown, otherwise will depend on the specific column filter availability.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.CanUserSort
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user is able to sort the data by clicking the column header.

remarks.para: If set to false, the user will not be able to sort the data, otherwise it will depend on the clicked column settings.

The first time the user click the column header the data will be sorted in ascending order, and the second time in descending order. if the Ctrl key is pressed while the user clicks the column header the sorting state of the others column will be preserved, otherwise the current column sort criteria will override the previous sorting state.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.CanUserGroup
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user is able to change groups by dragging column headers over the grouping area, removing groups pressing the remove button of each grouped column element inside the grouping area, or change the order of the groups clicking the grouped column element itself.
member.remarks: If you want to show the grouping panel but you want to prevent the user from changing the groups, set to true and set this property to false.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.CanUserAddRows
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user is able to enter new rows by entering the data in each cell of the "new row" typically located at the bottom of the data grid.

remarks.para: If set to false the "new row" element will not appear, therefore the user will not be able to enter new rows.
Notice the availability of this feature is conditioned to the fact that the set supports adding new items.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.CanUserEditRows
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user is able to edit the data of the cells.
member.remarks: If you want to prevent users from removing rows as well you can use instead.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.CanUserRemoveRows
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user is able to remove rows by pressing Del key.

remarks.para: If you want to prevent users from adding and editing rows as well you can use instead.
Notice the availability of this feature is conditioned to the fact that the set supports removing items.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.CanUserToggleDetails
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user is able to change the visibility of the row details by clicking a toggle button located in the top right corner of the corresponding row header.

remarks.para: Notice must be set in order to display the toggle button.
Optionally the property can be set if the requirements fits one of the built-in modes.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.CanUserFreezeColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating which of the freezing separators (currently only Left separator is supported) the user is able to drag in order to change the amount of frozen columns or rows.
member.remarks: Notice must be set to true so that the separator is visible.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user is able to add remove or modify info from the .

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.HeadersVisibility
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether column or row headers are displayed or not.
member.remarks: Default value is All, Both column and row headers will be shown.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.GridLinesVisibility
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the horizontal or vertical grid lines among cells are displayed or not.
member.remarks: Default value is Vertical

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.NewRowVisibility
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates where the new row will be located. If Top is set the new row will be located on top of the data rows, if Bottom is set will be located at the bottom of the data rows.
member.remarks: This property can be used along with or to make the row always visible when the user scrolls the data.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.ShowFluidMouseOver
member.summary: When set to true, hides the mouse over of the rows provides a fluid mouse effect over the body of the . Uses the FluidMouseOverBrush and the RowHeight.
member.remarks: Recommended use of this property is for not editable with fixed RowHeight, in other cases the selection might be confusing for the end user.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.ShowValidationIndicators
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the validation icon will appear inside the corresponding row header as well as the background of the row with errors is turned to red.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.ShowVerticalFreezingSeparator
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating which of the freezing separators (currently only Left separator is supported) is visible.

remarks.para: If you want to prevent the user from changing the amount of frozen columns you should set the property to None.
Additionally you can change the width of the separator by changing the property .

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.ShowGroupingPanel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the panel above the cells area used to group by a column is displayed.
member.remarks: If you want to show the grouping panel but you want to prevent the user from changing the groups you should set the property to false.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.VerticalScrollBarVisibility
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates how the vertical scroll bar is displayed.
member.remarks: Default value is Auto.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.HorizontalScrollBarVisibility
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates how the horizontal scroll bar is displayed.
member.remarks: Default value is Auto.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.ColumnWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the column width for all the columns in the .
member.remarks:
supports four different modes
TypeDescription
PixelThe width of the column will be the same as the amount of pixels specified.
AutoThe width of the column will be determined by the content of the cells in the columns.
StarThe viewport space will be divided among the Star and AutoStar columns.
AutoStarEach column is assured to have enough space to show its content and when extra space is available it is divided among the Star and AutoStar columns.
If a column has the property set, the layout will take the value set in the column over the one in the data grid.
Notice and has precedence over this property, that mean that if you set ColumnWidth=100 and MinColumnWidth=110 the actual value will be 110.
If you want to know the actual width in pixels of an auto-width column you should query .

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.MinColumnWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum column width for all the columns in the .
member.remarks: If a column has the property set, the layout will take the value set in the column over the one in the data grid.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.MaxColumnWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum column width for all the columns in the .
member.remarks: If a column has the property set, the layout will take the value set in the column over the one in the data grid.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.IndentWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width in pixels of each indentation level visible when the data is grouped.
member.remarks: The width of the leading column (that is the empty space between the row headers and the first column, only visible when the data grid is grouped) is determined by default as (IndentWidth * number of grouping levels). If you want to change that value you can set .

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.LeadingColumnWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the column width for the leading column (that is the empty space between the row headers and the first column, only visible when the data grid is grouped).
member.remarks: If the value is set to Auto, the width of the leading column will be calculated as (IndentWidth * number of group levels).

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.LeadingColumnWidthChanged
member.summary: Event raised when the property has changed.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.ColumnHeaderHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height in pixels of all the column headers.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.RowHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the row height for all the data rows in the .

remarks.para: Only Pixel and Auto modes are allowed. If the value to be set is of type pixel, the amount of pixels must be specified, If the value is of type Auto, the height of the row will be determined by the content of the cells of each row.
If a row has the property set, the layout will take the value set in the row over the one in the data grid.
Notice and has precedence over this property, that mean that if you set RowHeight=100 and MinRowHeight=110 the actual value will be 110.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.GroupRowHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the row height for all rows of type group in the .
member.remarks: See for more details.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.MinRowHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum row height for all the rows in the .
member.remarks: If a row has the property set, the layout will take the value set in the row over the one in the data grid.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.MaxRowHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum row height for all the rows in the .
member.remarks: If a row has the property set, the layout will take the value set in the row over the one in the data grid.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.ColumnHeaderClickAction
member.summary: Gets or sets which action will be taken when user click a column header. By default the click action will execute a sorting operation, but this behavior can be changed to allow a user to select a whole column by pressing the corresponding column header. Typically used in Excel like scenarios.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.VerticalScrollStep
member.summary: Gets a value indicating how the vertical scroll behaves when user press the up/down buttons of the vertical scroll bar or when the user uses the mouse wheel. This property is useful when the detail of the rows is too big, typically used in hierarchical scenarios.

item.description: Always a row will be scrolled independently the size of the row.
Each time the mouse wheel event is raised an specified number of pixels is scrolled.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.ScrollMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the scroll behavior of the .
member.remarks:
ModeDescription
RealTimeThe page is updated every time the ThumbTrack event of the is fired.
DeferredThe page is updated once the EndScroll event of the is fired.
Default value is RealTime.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.C1DataGrid.FiltersCombination
member.summary: Gets or sets the logical way the filters are combined among the columns.
member.remarks: By default when the user filters the data by setting the filter in more than one column, the logical operator applied among filters is "And", that means that the data displayed must obey the criteria set in both filters. This can be changed to "Or" in order to allow showing data that obey at least one filter criteria.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridColumn.GetCellContentRecyclingKey(C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridRow)
member.summary: Key used to store the cell content for future reuse in a shared pool.

remarks.para: Columns returning the same RecyclingKey will be candidate to share the same cells content instances.
Typically this method returns the type of the element returned by the method CreateCellContent.

Cell content lifecycle.
If there is no recycled cell content matching the recycling key, the method CreateCellContent will be called to create a new one.
Once the cell content is created or a recycled one is taken, the method BindCellContent will be called.
When the cell content is not being used the method UnbindCellContent will be called, and the cell content will be saved for future use in other cells.

member.param: This parameter can be used to have different cell content depending on the row. In most cases this parameter won't be used.
member.returns: The recycling key, or null to disable recycling.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridColumn.CreateCellContent(C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridRow)
member.summary: Creates the visual element that will be used to display the info inside a cell of this column.
member.remarks: This method is only called if no cell content is found in the shared pool matching the recycling key returned by the method GetCellContentRecyclingKey.
member.param: This parameter might be used to have different cell content depending on the row. In most cases this parameter won't be used
member.returns: Visual element used to display the content of a cell.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridColumn.BindCellContent(System.Windows.FrameworkElement,C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridRow)
member.summary: Initializes the cell content presenter.

remarks.para: This method must include cellContent property settings, SetBinding of the corresponding dependency property being "row.DataItem" the source which can be set directly in the binding or as DataContext of the cellContent.
This method is called after a cell content is created or a recycled one is taken.

member.param: Visual element that will be bound in order to display the cell content. If the cellContent received is not the expected you'll probably need to override the method GetCellContentRecyclingKey.
Row for which the cell will be initialized.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridColumn.UnbindCellContent(System.Windows.FrameworkElement,C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridRow)
member.summary: Unbinds the content of the cell.
member.remarks:
This method is called before the cell content is recycled.
If you set the DataContext in the BindCellContent method, you must set it to null here to avoid memory leaking.
member.param: Visual element which is currently bound to the row.
The row currently bound to the cellContent.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridColumn.GetCellEditingContent(C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridRow)
member.summary: Creates and initialize the visual element that will be used to edit the info of a cell belonging to this column when the cell is in edit mode.

remarks.para: The returned element won't be recycled, once the editing is finished the visual element will be discarded. if you need to release resources you can do it in the method .
It is no necessary to set the Source of the binding because the DataContext of the returned element will be set.

member.param: The row corresponding to the editing cell.
member.returns: Visual element used to edit the data of a cell when it is in edit mode.

member.param: The element that the column displays for a cell in editing mode.
member.returns: The returned object will be passed in the method as a parameter in order to set the original value in the editing element when user cancel the edit.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridColumn.GetColumnHeaderPresenterRecyclingKey
member.summary: Key used to store the column header for future reuse in a shared pool.

remarks.para: Columns returning the same RecyclingKey will be candidate to share the same column header instances.

Column header presenter lifecycle.
If there is no recycled column header matching the recycling key, the method CreateColumnHeaderPresenter will be called to create a new one.
Once the column header is created or a recycled one is taken, the method will be called.
When the column header is not being used the method will be called, and the column header will be saved for future use in other columns.

member.returns: The recycling key, or null to disable recycling.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridColumn.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of this column.

remarks.para:
supports four different modes
TypeDescription
PixelThe width of the column will be the same as the amount of pixels specified.
AutoThe width of the column will be determined by the content of the cells in the columns.
StarThe viewport space will be divided among the Star and AutoStar columns.
AutoStarEach column is assured to have enough space to show its content and when extra space is available it is divided among the Star and AutoStar columns.
Notice and has precedence over this property, that mean that if you set Width=100 and MinWidth=110 the actual value will be 110.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridRow.GetRowPresenterRecyclingKey
member.summary: Key used to store the row presenter for future reuse in a shared pool.

remarks.para: Rows returning the same RecyclingKey will be candidate to share the same row presenter instances.

Row presenter lifecycle.
If there is no recycled row presenter matching the recycling key, the method CreateRowPresenter will be called to create a new one.
Once the row presenter is created or a recycled one is taken, the method BindRowPresenter will be called.
When the row presenter is not being used the method UnbindRowPresenter will be called, and the row presenter will be saved for future use in other rows.
Typically this method returns the type of the element returned by the method CreateRowPresenter.

member.returns: The recycling key, or null to disable recycling.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridRow.CreateRowPresenter
member.summary: Creates a new row presenter.
member.remarks: This method is only called if no row presenter is found in the shared pool matching the recycling key returned by the method GetRowPresenterRecyclingKey.
member.returns: The row presenter.

member.summary: Initializes the row presenter.
member.remarks: This method is called after a row presenter is created or a recycled one is taken.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridRow.UnbindRowPresenter(C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridRowPresenter)
member.summary: This method is called before the row presenter is recycled.
member.param: Row presenter currently used in this row.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridRow.GetRowPresenterStyle
member.summary: Gets the row presenter style.
member.returns: The row presenter style.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridRow.GetRowHeaderPresenterRecyclingKey
member.summary: Key used to store the row header for future reuse in a shared pool.

remarks.para: Rows returning the same RecyclingKey will be candidate to share the same row header instances.

Row header presenter lifecycle.
If there is no recycled row header matching the recycling key, the method CreateRowHeaderPresenter will be called to create a new one.
Once the row header is created or a recycled one is taken, the method BindRowHeaderPresenter will be called.
When the row header is not being used the method UnbindRowHeaderPresenter will be called, and the row header will be saved for future use in other rows.
Typically this method returns the type of the element returned by the method CreateRowHeaderPresenter.

member.returns: The recycling key, or null to disable recycling.

member.remarks: This method is only called if no row header presenter is found in the shared pool matching the recycling key returned by the method GetRowHeaderPresenterRecyclingKey.
member.returns: The row header presenter corresponding to this row.

member.summary: Initializes the row header presenter.
member.remarks: This method is called after a row header is created or a recycled one is taken.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridRow.GetCellContentRecyclingKey(C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridColumn)
member.summary: Key used to store the cell content for future reuse in a shared pool.

remarks.para: Columns returning the same RecyclingKey will be candidate to share the same cells content instances.

Cell content lifecycle.
If there is no recycled cell content matching the recycling key, the method CreateCellContent will be called to create a new one.
Once the cell content is created or a recycled one is taken, the method BindCellContent will be called.
When the cell content is not being used the method UnbindCellContent will be called, and the cell content will be saved for future use in other cells.

Typically this method returns the recycling key of the column passed by parameter. In some cases like FilterRow (row with TextBoxes in each cell to filter) the content of the cell is independent of the column, in this case this method will be overridden.

member.param: The column for which the recycling key is being requested.
member.returns: The recycling key, or null to disable recycling.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridRow.CreateCellContent(C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridColumn)
member.summary: Creates the visual element that will be used to display the info inside a cell of this column.
member.remarks: This method is only called if no cell content is found in the shared pool matching the recycling key returned by the method GetCellContentRecyclingKey.
member.param: The column for which the cell content element is being requested.
member.returns: Visual element used to display the content of a cell.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridRow.BindCellContent(System.Windows.FrameworkElement,C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridColumn)
member.summary: Initializes the cell content presenter.

remarks.para: This method must include cellContent property settings, SetBinding of the corresponding dependency property being "row.DataItem" the source which can be set directly in the binding or as DataContext of the cellContent.
This method is called after a cell content is created or a recycled one is taken.

member.param: Visual element that will be bound in order to display the cell content. If the cellContent received is not the expected you'll probably need to override the method GetCellContentRecyclingKey.
The column for which the cell content will be initialized.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridRow.UnbindCellContent(System.Windows.FrameworkElement,C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridColumn)
member.summary: This method is called before the cell content is recycled.
member.remarks: If you set the DataContext in the BindCellContent method, you must set it to null here to avoid memory leaking.
member.param: Visual element which is currently bound to the row.
The column for which the cell content is currently bound.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridRow.GetCellContentStyle(C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridColumn)
member.summary: Gets the style which will be applied to the cell content.
member.param: The column for which the cell content style is requested.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridRow.GetCellEditingContent(C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridColumn)
member.summary: Creates and initialize the visual element that will be used to edit the info of a cell belonging to this column when the cell is in edit mode.

item.description: The returned element won't be recycled, once the editing is finished the visual element will be discarded. if you need to release resources you can do it in the method EndEdit
It is no necessary to set the Source of the binding because the DataContext of the returned element will be set.

member.param: The column for which the cell editing content is requested.
member.returns: Visual element used to edit the data of a cell when it is in edit mode.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridRow.IndentWidth

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridRow.DefaultHeight
member.summary: Gets the default height of the row.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridRow.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of this row.

remarks.para:
supports four different modes but only and are supported for rows.
TypeDescription
PixelThe height of the row will be the same as the amount of pixels specified.
AutoThe height of the row will be determined by the content of the cells in the row.
Notice and has precedence over this property, that mean that if you set Height=100 and MinHeight=110 the actual value will be 110.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.DataGrid.DataGridSelectionDragEventArgs.GetPosition(System.Windows.UIElement)
member.summary: Returns the x- and y-coordinates of the mouse pointer position, optionally evaluated against a coordinate origin of a supplied System.Windows.UIElement.
member.param: Any System.Windows.UIElement-derived object that is contained by the Silverlight plug-in and connected to the object tree. To specify the object relative to the overallSilverlightcoordinate system, use a relativeTovalue ofnull.
member.returns: A System.Windows.Point that represents the current x- and y-coordinates of the mouse pointer position. If null was passed as relativeTo, this coordinate is for the overall Silverlight plug-in content area. If a non-null relativeTo was passed, this coordinate is relative to the object referenced by relativeTo.
